embeds.title: Olexa's Shield
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Swap the positions of the Bolstering Ghostflame and the first Searing Ghostflame.
*Protection on-demand.*

embeds.title: Searing
embeds.description:
Keyword / Downfall

Ghostflame. Ignites when 2 Attacks are played while Active. Ignition: When Ignited, apply 4 Soulburn to a random enemy.

embeds.title: Bolstering
embeds.description:
Keyword / Downfall

Ghostflame. Ignites when a Power is played while Active. Ignition: When Ignited, gain 4 **Block** :p_block: and 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: Amazing with <Sneaky Teakwood Match>, and is also essentially an extra <Tricky's Bolster Rod> with some extra benifit

embeds.title: Sneaky Teakwood Match
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

At the start of each combat, **Ignite** the current Ghostflame and **Advance.**
*Lights on any surface!*

embeds.title: Tricky's Bolster-Rod
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Downfall

The first time you play a Power card each combat, gain 6 **Block** :p_block: and 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*Backed by the study of a thousand books. Knowledge is power!*

messages.content: Its almost always a pickup for me, especially with the amount of powers i pick up on hexa
im always gonna have at least 1 in my starting hand by mid-act 2
to add, it comboes well with the bolster rod as its essentially and anchor/inflame on demand

funnily enough:
Olexa and Sneakyteak have not done a collab
Funnily enough: I love both of these relics and never have heard of any of the referenced creators

Any relic that can give you good turn 1's is usually very valuable, and this certainly qualifies. It's sort of like an anchor that you won't necessarily always trigger on turn 1, and can even choose not to if you're not being attacked. You can always upgrade certain powers to make them innate so that It's more consistent, which is pretty nice, and hexaghost often ends up with lots of powers anyways. The strength gain is also very handy to get as early in the fight as possible to optimize your damage. Bolstering ghostflame is typically the most important flame to ignite, so being able to do so earlier in fights is great.
What innate powers does hexa have? Isn't it just the extra sb?
<? hexaghost innate>

messages.content: and speedrunning but...
Question: does anyone ever take <speedrunning>?

embeds.title: Speedrunning
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you Advance, gain 2 temporary :p_temp: **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: Wait does it count the advance done at the beginning/end of the turn?
If so then it's just a worse inflame on a character that gets a lot less value from strength. If not it is just the worst hexa card by a pretty wide margin.
What multihits does hexa even have? incinerate and the x cost?
anything else?

Speedrunning is not good. I have tried to make it work, and it is a huge struggle. Maybe you could get a brew going with orange pellets, but as you mentioned, hexaghost doesn't even really scale that well with strength, not a lot of multi hits, no vulnerable that I can remember, and is very capable of dealing damage via soulburn, which doesn't factor in strength. I just assumed hexaghost had some powers that upgrade to innate, so many downfall characters do.
2 innate powers, and one is pretty horrible, the other is alright, I think a bit slow but it's serviceable.
But strength on hexa is bad not only because of the lack if multihits, but bolstering ghostflame being a semi-reusable strength source means you also need to compete with that
And although there is only a few cards that can activate it indefinitely, you still can get a lot of value from it.
I think overall Olexa's is alright, it fits the same overall idea of <bolster rod>

embeds.title: Tricky's Bolster-Rod
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Downfall

The first time you play a Power card each combat, gain 6 **Block** :p_block: and 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*Backed by the study of a thousand books. Knowledge is power!*

messages.content: That is to justify early power usage, since the block is nothing to scoff at.

The difference is that bolster rod just basically materializes the strength and block, Olexa's shield just takes it from a later point. When you get to where the bolstering gf was and you have 2 back to back attack gfs that is really bad, and sometimes your sb will already have gone off if you didn't get a power turn 1 but still set off the sb tick.

I think the idea of stealing strength from later in the combat to help turn 1 is a good tradeoff (think <deca's washers>), deca's washers is 3 draw for -1 draw later. This is a chance at early strength and block at the cost of a longer term gf strategy.

embeds.title: Deca's Washers
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of each combat, draw 3 additional cards and add a Dazed into your draw pile.
*It is unclear why Deca collects these.*

messages.content: I don't think the value of getting off a power early with more protection is worth the longer scale worsening of the ghostflame strat.
Especially since none of the seals have any effect during the combat, only after (so playing them early kinda sucks, but spending an upgrade to remove the ethereal is pretty bad).
And hexa's innate powers are average and garbage.
The list of non-seal powers on hexa are <Empowered flame> <floatwork> <speedrunning> <extra crispy> <radiant flame> <gifts from beyond> <infernal form> <volcano visage> <poltergeist>

messages.content: <devil's dance> <Doomsday> and <here and now>

embeds.title: Devil's Dance
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 (1) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

The first time you Retract each turn, gain :e_hexa: and draw 1 card.
**Retract.**

embeds.title: Doomsday
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

The next time all (at) 6 (least)  (5 ) Ghostflames are Ignited, take an extra turn.

embeds.title: Here and Now
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 (0) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

You no longer Advance at the end of turn.
At the start of your turn, gain :e_hexa: .

messages.content: 12 powers plus the 6 seals meaning 18 powers. Lets see how I think each would do with olexa's implying you drew them turn 1.

empowered flame - kinda alright, but the fact that this type of deck actively hurts gf builds I'd say taking a card that's only benefit is buffing gf is not the best decision

floatwork - I rarely ever actually play this card

speedrunning - card sucks

extra crispy - probably one of the better synergies, being the only good innate power, but most SB applying cards are skills, so getting through the back to back crushing gf can be rough

radiant flame - still has the same issue as empowered flame. This relic hurts the health of gf for the whole fight for the turn 1 help

gifts from beyond - especially unupgraded this can be a tough power to play, since it doesn't have any effect for sometimes multiple turns, as reclaimed cards go into your discard pile. Olexa's does help gifts a lot if you draw it turn 1, since that extra block means it will be easier to block.

Infernal form - see empowered flame, but it being 3 cost means the little bit of block gain does help since otherwise you would be left defenseless unless you have an energy relic

Volcano visage - similar problems to earlier mentioned cards, but I think that this is just way stronger than other gf support power

poltergeist - no

Devil's dance - this puts you in an extremely awkward position. You are now on the inferno gf with only 1 gf lit. That's not good damage.

doomsday - this card is really strong, and I feel like it is slightly weaker with olexa's since you need to get through back to back attack gfs, but with the upgrade you can skip one so it isn't as bad, it just means you can't skip any other gf.

here and now - This can get you stuck on the bolstering gf, and without a lot of advance you won't make it through the gfs, and it makes the 2 attack gfs that much more grueling to get through

overall only like 2 powers really like it for the long term fight, but that immediate strength and block gained can help in act 1. I wouldn't ever buy it outside of a desperate act 1 with a lot of powers but not much direction (which these types of decks don't work too well tbh, but if you can survive taking a few 2-5 seals and can then scale harder into acts 2 and 3 it can pay off)

I just think it gets so heavily outclassed by bolster rod though, since they both hold the same purpose but one just accelerates the buffs gotten and makes those later turns harder, while the other just gives it to you for free)
There is <devider> I guess

embeds.title: Divider
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Deal 3 (5) damage.
Repeat for each Ignited Ghostflame.

messages.content: <here and now> with <again> though

embeds.title: Here and Now
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 (0) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

You no longer Advance at the end of turn.
At the start of your turn, gain :e_hexa: .

embeds.title: Again!
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 (0) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Ignite** the current Ghostflame, then **Extinguish** it.

messages.content: Like again on bolstering makes the inability to advance worth it
Devil's dance can be counteracted with any card that advances
Also how does radiant flame not help for bolstering it literally gives it extra defense

Yes but the second that you are not on bolstering and want to do a full cycle, you have to go through the two attack ghostflames. Most decks don't have that many attacks so that means you may spend multiple turns stuck in attack ghostflame zone
Meaning you aren't activating ghostflames.
I mean some decks revovle around activating the same ghostflame multiple times
Olexa's shield is basically a tradeoff. You can play your first power easier but your ghostflame cycle is garbage.
Then Olexa's is mildly helpful, since those decks often have a lot of advance and retract already to get back to the desired gf
so getting to bolstering isn't as helpful since it probably already was able to get there fast enough on its own.
